metadata.synopsis: When his mother's (Shiho Fujimura) untimely death quickly follows his father's (Yasutaka Tsutsui), Dr. Yukio Daitokuji (Masahiro Motoki) thinks a killer is targeting him and his amnesiac wife, Rin (Ryô). Soon, Yukio is assaulted by Sutekichi (also Motoki), a twin Yukio never knew existed because their parents abandoned him. He tosses Yukio down a well and has an encounter with Rin that eventually reveals her forgotten past, but Yukio escapes to battle Sutekichi.

reviews: A fabulous and unique romance horror narrative that succeeds in uncovering the often-forgotten truth that all speaking beings are driven by a desire to be loved/desire to love.
Gemini morphs into a strange, mannered melodrama of the haves and the have-nots, of nature and nurture.

Tsukamoto proved with "Gemini" that he could be equally provocative and artful in different genres, while managing to present a movie that stood out from the J-horror wave by implementing a rather more extreme approach
